conclusion: Determine deflection angles of ions caused by electric and magnetic fields, then calculate final velocity after passing through velocity selector and magnetic analyzer.
Ions are accelerated horizontally and enter the velocity selector.
Velocity selector has a quarter-circular ring cross-section with inner and outer radii of R1 and R2.
Ions are deflected by the magnetic field in the velocity selector.
Ions are deflected by the magnetic field in the magnetic analyzer.
Magnetic analyzer has a cross-section that is a quarter-circular ring with inner and outer radii of R1 and R2.
Ions are deflected by the electric field in the magnetic analyzer.
Ions are deflected by the electric and magnetic fields in the deflection system.
Deflection system has a cube with side length L.
Ions are deflected by the electric field in the deflection system.
Ions are deflected by the magnetic field in the deflection system.
Deflection angles of ions caused by electric and magnetic fields are both small.
When α is small, sinα ≈ tanα ≈ α, and cos α ≈ 1-1/2α².
Final velocity of ions after passing through velocity selector and magnetic analyzer can be calculated using v = v₀ sinα.
Initial velocity of ions is the same as velocity after passing through velocity selector.
Final velocity of ions is the same as velocity after passing through magnetic analyzer.
Final velocity of ions is the same as velocity after passing through deflection system.
Final velocity of ions after passing through velocity selector and magnetic analyzer is v = v₀ sinα.
